betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Welcome to §2§lGregTech: The Community Modpack§r.

This modpack features §2§lGregtech: Community Edition Unofficial§r, known as GTCEu or CEu, a continuation of GTCE. This mod provides a lot more content through all the tiers and up to §dUltimate Voltage§r, and a non negligible amount Quality of Life.

This is a pure Tech modpack, focusing on GregTech and its progression. You will find no better place to learn about this mod and all the features it adds. At any point, feel free to run the command §9/bq_admin edit§r to open any quest (even if you have them locked) and read through them to gather information. §6This questbook is very informative§r, so check it out even if the modpack doesn't pick your interest that much.


If you feel like some mods are missing, the one explanation is that this modpack is lightweight! Feel free to add mods to your instances, but don't add anything that breaks the progression. Promise?

Whenever you update the modpack, run the command §9/bq_admin default load§r to refresh the questbook. There will be frequent updates shortly after the release.§r


Informative Quests such as this will appear in both the chapter it is unlocked, and the Information Tab. Regularly come back to the Information Tab if you feel like you forgot something.


Quest outlines are merely the main goals. §6Every single Quest is extremely important or provide crucial Information§r, §cif something is optional, it will be stated§r.


Modpack can be played on §dPeaceful§r, and we recommand you to do so. You may also use the keepInventory Gamerule and abuse minimap teleport as you see fit. This modpack is not focusing on survival.


Make good use of §aJEI§r. Items have several recipes, so do not stop at the first displayed. Identify patterns in autogenerated recipes (example: Packer recipes have a lot of nugget -> ingot conversion). When complex recipes arise, we will make sure to guide you through the best path to a product.

§oA minecraft adventure starting with Wood!? This is truly unoriginal, I want a refund...§r

If you're familiar with GregTech, you may be aware of nerfed vanilla recipes. This modpack features very few of them, and Wood won't be a chore!

Here, get some food. If you're playing on Peaceful, put it on a display.

Here's a list of some of the things you'll be needing for early game. Collect more than in this quest, you will need more.

I would advise doing this quest first and take the §6Reward§r. That way you can start with tools before any mining.

§oGlass, at last!§r

Use Mortars or a Macerator (your choice!) to microcraft your way to Glass Dust, which you can then turn into §aGlass block§r.
Glass will be easier later on. I am certain you have noticed that juicy Arc Furnace recipe.

Glass tubes will be required for Electronic Circuits, so make some!

The Ore Generation is very different from your usual modpacks. Vanilla ores are disabled. And GregTech ores generate in §dhuge veins§r.

The veins and their details can be found in §aJEI§r. They contain up to four different ores, and the total amount of ores per vein can go to four digits. Yes! This much.

Surface rocks will indicate the type of veins that are below them. In §aJEI§r, press U on the Tiny Dust you mined from the rock and navigate to the §aOre Page§r.

Ore veins generate in a §4Grid§r. Every vein is spaced by 3 chunks from one to another in a cardinal direction.
To check if you find yourself in a vein, press §4F3§r and look at the Chunk line. The second set of numbers tells you the §9chunk section§r. You want both the X and Z chunk numbers to be at §b1 plus a multiple of 3§r (-8, -5, -2, 1, 4, 7, ...).
Alternatively, you may check if a rock is in the exact center of a chunk (X=8, Z=8). If it is, you are highly likely to have a vein under your feet.

§2Once you find a vein, you will know other veins spawn 3 chunks apart.§r

However Ores veins may be deleted by caves, Oil deposits, or from trying to generate above the ground.
§


In §6LV Age§r, you can craft an Ore Prospector to assist yourself in finding ores.


There is no "void" ore generation in this modpack, but due to the large size of vein and complex Ore Processing, you won't have a resource issue with the late game!

§oDid you know GregTech has tools equivalent to vanilla tools? Did you know some of them are actually better?§r

Here, the Axe for example, this one is a beast! Mine a Wood Log and it will §6fell the entire tree§r for you! Who needs Ore Excavation? Not me, not you!


Take these spruce saplings to grow 2x2 giant trees. There's a lot of smelting coming up, charcoal will help you with that!
betterquesting:10.name:8: I must Axe in two Questions

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§oWrought Iron has a very low carbon content and is tougher than regular Iron.§r

GregTech Tools made of Wrought Iron will have §650% additional durability§r compared to regular Iron.

You can make it from §asmelting Iron Nuggets§r, and §arecombining the Nuggets§r. Do not convert all your Iron as it is not interchangeable.

Here's your Introduction to GregTech tools. Something that may confuse you is how JEI displays Neutronium tools. But in fact you can make the tools off §dmany materials§r. The first one being Iron...! Or Wrought Iron if you read that quest.


§9§lHammer:§r A crafting tool used to for a lot of early game recipes. It also works as a mining tool for ores to crush them, more information on that later. Its last function is to mute machines by §msmacking§r right-clicking them.

As an additional on §lall§r GregTech tools. You can §6repair§r them in an §6Anvil§r using the material of the tool itself, like any vanilla tool!


§eNote:§r Any Quest with GregTech tools can be completed with the tool crafted from any material, not just the one displayed.

§oThis hammer is very different. It's a pickaxe, but also not. It's a 3x3 pickaxe!§r

Definitively use this, do it! You want it, I know it! This bad boy will give you so many ores in no time, given you are in a vein.


§eNote:§r Any Quest with GregTech tools can be completed with the tool crafted from any material, not just the one displayed.

§oIron is very abundant! And not just in the form of pure Iron Ore. In reality, Iron is found in a lot of oxide forms or minerals.§r

Any of these Ores can be smelted directly to Iron. That is §dfour veins§r that virtually have Iron Ore. Consult the ore tab for a list of all the veins available.

Do not bother about ore processing yet. §aDirect smelting will be the most efficient for a while§r, given how easy it is to obtain a lot of ores.


Gather §eany§r of the Iron yielding Ore to complete this quest.

More GregTech tools are required for progression, here are the most important of them all.

§9§lWrench:§r A crafting tool. But also a mining tool for GregTech machines (perfect if you think using pickaxes is unethical). Is that it? Certainly not! It has right click functions to double as a Forge §6Wrench for other mods§r. Right Click also allows you to set the output side of GregTech machines. Shift right clicking allows you to rotate GregTech machines.

§9§lFile:§r A crafting tool. And that's it. Yes.

§9§lSaw:§r Another crafting tool. If we were evil, we would force it to obtain 4 planks and 4 sticks from the respective recipes. That said you can use it to get 6 planks per log, if you wish.


§eNote:§r Any Quest with GregTech tools can be completed with the tool crafted from any material, not just the one displayed.

More tools, not important right now, but required later on.

§9§lScrewdriver:§r A crafting tool. Right click on specific machines allows for special configuration.

§9§lWire Cutter:§r A crafting tool. If the config for GT6-style wire connection is enabled, this is needed to connect wires together. Right click on wires will enable or disable connection to other blocks.

§9§lMortar:§r A crafting tool, to grind various things into dust form.

§9§lKnife:§r A mediocre weapon, but also... you guessed it, a crafting tool!

§9§lSoft Mallet:§r A tool to pause machines from working with right-click. Right-clicking again resumes working.

§9§lCrowbar:§r A niche tool to remove Covers from GregTech machines with a right-click.


§eNote:§r Any Quest with GregTech tools can be completed with the tool crafted from any material, not just the one displayed.

§oMaybe you thought forcing crafting with tools would make your life painful. I shall present you the solution: the Crafting Station.§r

The Crafting Station is a highly §9advanced Crafting Table§r, with inventory slots for item and tools. Put the recipes either by dropping ghost items, or using the §a+§r in JEI. Crafting the items will use the items and tools in the inventory. The 9 slots on the right are saved up recipes so you can re-use them without re-opening JEI.

The most important part making the Crafting Station amazing, is the fact that §6it can use adjacent inventories§r in addition to its own inventory. This is essentially a mini ME Crafting Terminal.


§bLore:§r Did you know the reason Omnifactory had Forestry in its modlist was primarily due to the Worktable? Since GTCE added the Crafting Station, they have started working on phasing out Forestry.

§oThis will be the first Project, or will it be?§r

Some GregTech modpacks disable Charcoal furnace smelting, which forces the Coke Oven. While Charcoal smelting is enabled here, you will want this multiblock for Creosote.

You can use it to make §aCoke from Coal§r, or §aCharcoal from Wood§r, in addition to §aCreosote as bonus§r output. Creosote can be used as furnace fuel to smelt §d32 items§r, and is required for the creation of §6Treated Wood Planks§r.


To craft this multiblock, you will first need the brick form, which doesn't get consumed in recipes. You will need 117 clay, and 195 sand.
Check the JEI multiblock preview for the structure pattern.

§9Note:§r Any Brick block can be replaced with a §9Coke Oven Hatch§r. That hatch allows for automation. It will auto-export Creosote into connected fluid containers, and it will also accept item insertion/extraction.

If you have no access to fluid voiding yet, but happen to have too much Creosote at hand, mine the Coke Oven block and replace it.


§bLore:§r The concept of Multiblock is very old in modded Minecraft. Back in 1.4.7, Railcraft introduced the Coke Oven, this was revolutionary at the time.

Gather more resources, namely Copper and Tin.

Check the ore tab to find out which veins they are coming from.

This quest requires §eeither§r Copper or Tin, so you can claim as reward the metal you're missing. You will however need a lot of both to go through the Steam Age.

Grind down some Copper and Tin into dust. You will need a Mortar from the "More Tools" quest.

Make much more than just 3 Bronze ingots. The Steam Age machines need a lot more.


It is advisable to start venturing in rivers and to start collecting Clay! Just saying...


§6The progression now continues in the Steam Age chapter.§r

§oThe bucket recipe is changed, it now requires Plates. #realism§r

§dPlates are used everywhere§r in GregTech. You make them §ausing two Ingots§r thanks to your newly made §aHammer§r. Better recipes for Plates will be unlocked later.


Here, take this wooden barrel full of water as a reward. You may ask why? No reason! Ah, just as a way to teach you that GTCEu tanks are all portable!

Why is this chapter called Steam Age again?
Anyways, you have access to three types of boilers. I recommend you start with the Coal Boiler as it is the cheapest to make, and is easy to maintain (the fuel consumption is tiny!).

Craft §eany§r of the boilers to complete this quest.

§oWhy is this chapter called Steam Age again? I can't be due to this machine, can it?§r

Anyways... The Coal Boiler is the only available Boiler for now, due to the Glass recipe. Make one, or two.

§cImportant:§r Boilers can §cexplode§r! Water does not mess too well with high temperatures, and a steam explosion may occur under the following conditions:
§9-§r The Boiler is hot, shown by the red bar in the GUI
§9AND
-§r The Boiler has no water, signified by the absence of blue bar
§9AND
-§r The Boiler receives water§r

You can be perfectly safe by filling the boiler with water before heating it up, and making sure it has water constantly. The drain is slow, so you don't have to worry too much.

The boiler will auto eject steam on all faces except bottom. For automated water input, use the bottom face.


§9Note 1:§r In this modpack, explosions are configured to not damage any block or entity, but you still lose your machine!

§9Note 2: §rYou may have noticed the unit L (Litres) used in certain places. 1 L is equivalent to, and used interchangeably with 1 mB.

§oThe Alloy Smelter makes alloys... The name didn't state it clearly enough.§r

Use it for more §6efficient Bronze§r, and for future alloys.

This is the most Steam hungry machine out of all of them. If you ever run out of steam, whack your machine with the Soft Mallet to pause it momentarily.

Steam Machines accept Steam into their internal storage tank, piped from Boilers.

Steam machines will run recipes from JEI up to §aUsage: 32 EU/t (LV)§r. EU may be the Energy Unit for Electric machines, but the Steam machines will run using a proportional amount of steam.
Regular Steam Machines are §9twice as slow§r as indicated by JEI.
High Pressure Steam Machines are the same speed as indicated by JEI, with adjused steam consumption.


After each recipe, the Steam machines will vent some cooler steam (particles) from the dot side.
§cImportant:§r Keep the exhaust port unblocked, this is neither an input or output slot! If the machine fails to vent steam, it will stop working.
§9Reminder:§r Use your Wrench to change which side the exhaust port is facing (right-click).


If you feel like sending yourself off to Heaven, I invite you to stand on top of pipes transporting steam, or you can also stand right in front of the vent as the machines are running recipes.

§oThe Steam Compressor compresses... I'm actually speechless.§r

I mean... that's it, nothing fancier. But you're unlocking new recipes for progression, mainly towards §9Steel§r!

§oThe Forge Hammer hammers... That's fascinating!§r

A lot of recipes are the same as your hand crafting recipes using a Hammer, but instead uses this machine! It is rather slow for that purpose though, so you shall still break several more Hammers.

It can process §aCobblestone in Gravel§r, and §aGravel into Sand§r. And it's fast at that too!

Last but not least, it makes Plates at a better ratio: §6three Ingots for two Plates§r. A worthwhile investment!


You know what? Bonus! Get an anvil back from crafting it. This is a small reminder that you can repair GregTech tools using an anvil.

§oThe Macerator macerates... I am done with this.§r

This means you can stop ruining your hands and destroying mortars grinding dusts by yourself, at the cost of time.

What this also means is §6Ore Processing§r, but that's a scary topic presented in the next quest.
§cThe macerator will output only the first item shown in recipes from JEI!§r The other slots are locked until much later in the game (HV Age to be precise).


§9My (important!) advice:§r it is better to keep directly smelting ores for now! The efficiency loss is made up with fast mining.

§oThe Steam Extractor extracts... I cannot believe my own words.§r

Not many recipes are in the Extractor, but it is used for rubber, which you will need soon!

Your first §mbig§r Project! This one is for Steel!

The Primitive Blast Furnace (PBF) is an inherently §5B A L A N C E D§r multiblock. If you do not have a §3Macerator§r yet, this multiblock will be §lfour times as expensive§r.
Using the Macerator, you will need 132 Clay, split into 66 Clay Dusts and 66 Brick Dusts.

Build the structure using JEI preview.

As for the Steel recipe, you will be rewarded if you used the Coke Oven earlier, as each Steel Ingot only requires §aone Coke§r instead of §aone Coal§r. Otherwise, you can simply use §aCharcoal§r as it is mostly free.
Using §aWrought Iron§r cuts the recipe duration significantly... if you have the sanity to smelt thousands of nuggets beforehand.


Steel will be §9extremely important throughout the entire game§r, make a lot of it!
Steel also has §6double the durability§r compared to regular Iron for GregTech tools. It also provides §6Diamond mining level§r.

§oSteel, the Shrödinger alloy of all alloys. Made with a very small percentage of carbon in mass, it is significantly tougher than Iron or Wrought Iron.§r

One PBF will most not likely cut it and be too slow. Make another one!

Did you know GregTech multiblocks can §dshare walls§r? This saves you a whole 12 Primitive Bricks for your second PBF.

What you may also do is upgrade to four PBFs. It just depends on how much of an innate speedrunner you are.


§bLore:§r In GregTech 5, one single Ingot of Steel takes 300 seconds in the PBF!
Pollution was also a thing, and four of these bad boys would guarantee your character would periodically get negative effects such as slowness, mining fatigue, or even nausea and poison.

The Primitive Water Pump is your first way to automatically generate water for your boilers. It does not pump water from the world, instead it just creates it.

It is a multiblock, so consult JEI for the structure.
Its functionality is fully explained in the description page in JEI.

Small tip for you: no need to worry about biome for now, as the boilers need very little water to keep up.

The Output Hatch is where water will be generated, you may have it face up or down to auto-output water into your pipes.
§9Reminder:§r Use a Wrench to rotate GregTech blocks (sneak right-click).


§bLore:§r This Multiblock was ported from IMPACT, a 1.7.10 GregTech modpack which we appreciate greatly.

Grow §dRubber Trees§r and cut them down to get §aSticky Resin§r.

§oDid you think we would force you to use Treetaps...?§r

Hopefully this shouldn't take too long. Mine some sulfur from the Nether.


§bLore:§r With the existence of Small Ores randomly scattered in GregTech 5, you could at some point mine enough in the Overworld to avoid the Nether Vein. It did require some dedication, though.

§oNow that you have Steel, you can make a Flint and Steel! Yes! Why would it not be made out of Steel?§r

Once you have a §9Flint and Steel§r, you have access to the Nether.
You could also light the Nether portal using alternative means... you dirty cheater...

The Nether has more veins and new ores! Check the Ore Tab for the Nether Veins.

Additionally, §6Nether Ores are worth two Overworld Ores§r.


If you are not playing on Peaceful yet, it is not too late! No need to bother fighting Ghasts or Blazes in this pure tech modpack.
§9Note:§r The Blaze and Enderman loot tables have been changed to Sulfur Dust and Ender Pearl Dust respectively, so you can't just rush the End.

§oPut that Resin into use! Rubber is an excellent insulation material, and that's exactly what it is gonna be used for.§r

The ratios in the recipes start at a mediocre rate. In LV age, it will be a lot better.


§bLore:§r In old GregTech 5, and in base GTCE, you needed to get string and black wool carpets as your first insulation material. §mThat was obviously better by far§r.

§oRed Alloy is... well, completely fictional.§r
It is an alloy of copper and redstone used for conductivity.

You will need some for Electronic Circuits.


§bLore:§r This material originally comes from RedPower, what a throwback!

High Pressure Boilers will be a better source of Steam to power your Steam machines.

Keep in mind energy conversion will use Steam to also power your Electric machines in the LV age. §cThere is no such thing as too few Boilers§r... well okay perhaps 100 is way too many.

Do you want a recommendation...? Well, you're out of luck, all of them are really good while having their own drawback. But I can tell you this: you will love the Advancement name from making an HP Solar Boiler.


Get §eany§r of the three proposed boilers to complete this quest.

If you remember in the Steam Information Quest, I told you how regular Steam machines had a duration penalty and were twice as slow.

High Pressure Steam machines no longer have any duration penalty for recipes, making them clear upgrades.

Make §eone§r of the proposed HP machines to complete this quest.

To its simplest form, Ore Processing in GregTech boils down to §aconverting one ore into two ingots through two dusts§r, like several other tech mods.

The added spice is the amount of steps, either optional or required. This small guide is an §dintroduction to Ore Processing§r.
The main purpose of GregTech Ore Processing is to provide §abyproducts§r on top of the initial outcome. At Steam Age, none of the byproducts are obtainable.

§9The steps available in Steam Age go as follows:§r
One Ore (block) §9->§r Two Crushed Ores (Macerator, or Hammer for 1:1 conversion)
One Crushed Ore §9->§r One Impure Dust (Hammer)
One Impure Dust §9->§r One Dust (§oIn world crafting explained below§r)
One Dust §9->§r One Ingot (Furnace, you should know this one)


The rule bends for ores giving more than two dusts (such as redstone), and for dusts that cannot be smelted (redstone again!). Yet you can still do direct smelting to get half the amount you would from the full processing.

§dJEI does not indicate Impure Dust to Clean Dust conversion§r, so keep that in mind that you should §athrow them into filled cauldrons§r (full stacks at once to use less water).

Ore Processing will be explained further once you get into LV Age.


There, take this nice reward for your efforts learning this beautiful mess.

§oThe Steam Grinder's big brother. Or little brother, don't let him know.§r

The Steam Oven is a great multiblock to §6effortlessly smelt large quantities of items.§r No more lines of furnaces that you have to manually empty and refuel.


As always, check JEI for the structure.

Recipes are handled differently than in previous Multiblocks or Singleblocks machines.
The main block acts as the brain.
Inputs go into the Input Bus.
Outputs come out of the Output Bus.
The Steam Hatch is the heart, pump steam in to power the whole thing.

§9Note:§r Buses and Hatches automatically import/export (depending on context) through their front face. This makes automation extremely easy. Simply place chests, drawers, anything you see fit next to their side with a dot.


§cOther note:§r This multiblock is much more expensive than your typical machines at this point. You will also need some alloys you have not crafted yet. Either be prepared to spend a lot of resources, or wait until you start LV Age (it will be easier).


§bLore:§r This Multiblock - despite being very similar to the Grinder - is not ported from a GregTech version or addon. Its actual origin is the Steam Oven from Railcraft, which datesback to 1.4.7!

§oThe Steam Oven's elder brother. Or perhaps it was the opposite?§r

The Steam Grinder is §lthe§r reason you will start doing Ore Processing. §6It can pulverize large batches of items fast and effortlessly.§r


As always, check JEI for the structure.

Recipes are handled differently than in previous Multiblocks or Singleblocks machines.
The main block acts as the brain.
Inputs go into the Input Bus.
Outputs come out of the Output Bus.
The Steam Hatch is the heart, pump steam in to power the whole thing.

§9Note:§r Buses and Hatches automatically import/export (depending on context) through their front face. This makes automation extremely easy. Simply place chests, drawers, anything you see fit next to their side with a dot.


§cOther note:§r This multiblock is much more expensive than your typical machines at this point. You will also need some alloys you have not crafted yet. Either be prepared to spend a lot of resources, or wait until you start LV Age (it will be easier).


§bLore:§r This Multiblock originally comes from GT++. It required Tumbaga to craft, an alloy with a mix of Gold and Bronze.

Make these molds, to be used for alloy smelting. Be sure to make Molds and not Extruder Shapes.

Take this reward, it will help you reduce the amount of malding by molding your gears.

§o*insert black&white paper gif*§r

Obtaining paper is more difficult than in vanilla, but also less efficient.


You will need to grind Sugar Canes into Chad, and then press and dry it with some weight, here stone.
§9Note 1:§r Stone slabs are not consumed in the recipe.


§9Note 2:§r Make a Sugar Cane manual farm.


§9Note 3:§r In LV Age, you will be able to make Paper from Wood, if you want more.


§9Note 4:§r The Crafting Station makes this microcrafting absolutely trivial, use it!


§9Note 5:§r Paper will be used as a poor wrapping material for the upcoming resistors.


§9Note 6:§r I have a pleasure to share this moment with you, fellow Greg enjoyer.


§9Note 7:§r If you didn't notice the meme reference in the quest title and the italics... Nothing will happen, let's move on.

§oThe harder component for circuits§r

Vacuum Tubes are painful to make, hehe.
Wires and Sticks are sadly very expensive right now, but they will get cheaper in LV Age.

Vacuum Tubes are also technically your first Ultra Low Voltage (ULV) Circuit! You won't find very much use for these by themselves though.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Electronics Part Three: The Vacuum Tubes

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§oThe circuiter part of circuits... Sorry I ran out of adjectives§r

Macerate Wood into Wood Pulp, then Compress it into Wood Plates. Combine it with Resin to make an empty board. Stick in some expensive copper wires (they will get cheaper in LV Age) and you have got the base for your first circuit.

§oThe easier component for circuits§r

You will want the recipes using Fine Wires as it will save you more materials overall.
This wire recipe is sadly expensive. But once you get to LV, they will become cheap.

§oThis quest technically requires all the previous quests it depends on, not just one. But I made it this way if you are a fast crafter and skipped some tasks. This is also a pretty big quest, so I figured it would be nice if you could see all the requirements ahead of time.§r

Your first §aElectronic Circuit§r!! YEEEEEEEEHAAAAAW!!
Just kidding, you actually need three Circuits to get started anywhere relevant in LV Age. Thanksfully for you, a generous donator under the name of Mr. Questbook Writer decided to give you the third Circuit.

Here, I'm also throwing a §aLV Machine Hull§r in this quest. That's what you need to make any LV machine! I am feeling so generous, that this quest will grant you a second hull, free of charge!

§6Once you complete this Quest and the LV Motor Quest, you are ready to move on to the LV Age.§r

All machines typically have one §cFront Face§r, and one §9Output Face§r.
The §cFront Face§r should be obvious.
The §9Output Face§r is the face with a dot or hole on it. By default, this is at the back of the machine as you place it.

Machines can §aauto-output§r through their output face. To turn on auto-output, click the appropriate button in the GUI. Fluid and item auto-outputs are toggled separately. Further control over auto-outputs can be achieved with §dFilters§r and §dCovers§r, which are explained in the quest to the left of this one.

Right-clicking a machine with a §aWrench§r changes the output side, and shift-right-clicking changes the front side. Keep in mind that the front side §ccannot§r also be the output side! 

By default, items and fluids cannot be inserted through the output side, but this can be toggled with a §9Screwdriver§r. Either right-click the output face directly, or shift-right-click on the grid corresponding to the side of the output.
Note: At the time of writing this, the chat message for output side is actually the opposite of what it actually does, whoops!

§oOne of the gatekeepers to the LV Age... You are getting close.§r

We are cutting down the retrieval task counts as you progress further into the modpack so you don't have to check several times which items to submit. Remember that JEI is your friend if you forgot how to craft things!

Craft six §aLV Electric Motors§r! This may seem like a lot, but that's the bare minimum required to get to the good stuff in LV Age.


§6Once you complete this Quest and the Electronic Circuit Quest, you are ready to move on to the LV Age.§r

§oTo not confound with a certain man.§r

The fluid pipes have been reworked in GTCEu, and they now work really well. The one issue they have is the limited throughput, which you may encounter as you upgrade to more and more boilers.

Potin Fluid Pipes have a very §6high Throughput§r, for the material tier and cost, you may use this.


§9Note:§r GT6-style Pipes are §denabled§r. It means that placing Pipes connect them only to the block they were placed against. To open more connection, use your §5Wrench§r on the grid.


§bLore:§r Potin Fluid Pipes were originally created in GT++, and were a huge power spike in GT:NH. Despite that fact, everybody seems to be enjoying them, and so we do too.
Other fun fact: this is an alloy used in coins! Don't question the logic.
A crafting component. Just like the LV Motor it is used to craft LV machines.

§oA crafting component, but also a cover!§r
(Next quest explain how to interact with covers)


The pump, when placed on a machine, will transfer fluid. You can configure it to import or export.
It can accept a §9Fluid Filter§r.

§oA crafting component, but also a cover!§r
(Next quest explains how to interact with covers)


The Conveyor Module, when placed on a machine, will transfer items. You can configure it to import or export.
This has a special interaction with Item Pipes to enable perfect §dRound Robin§r.
It can also accept various §9Item Filters§r.

§oA crafting component, OH MY GOSH THIS ONE IS EXPENSIVE, but also a cover!§r
(Next quest explain how to interact with covers)


The Robot Arm, when placed on a machine, is a more advanced Conveyor Module. It lets you transfer items in specific batches, at specific rates, or keep a certain amount of items stocked.
Actual uses for the Robot Arm will be explained in future Quests as tutorial.

§9Note:§r The functionalities provided by the Robot Arm work §lonly§r if it is doing the operation.


§bLore:§r GregTech 5 had blocks such as the Buffer, Filter and Type Filter to allow fine control over items. In GTCE it's all been replaced by the almighty Robot Arm and various Filter Covers. That is a lot more compact!

§oCovers are ways to give your machines extra behavior without using any extra block space.§r

Covers are placed by right-clicking with it on a face of a machine, and removed with a Crowbar (or by mining the machine, but that's too brutal!).

Pretty much any GregTech TileEntity will accept Covers, even if they provide no functionality.

For the Covers transferring Items/Fluids, you will have a button to enable/disable other forms of transfer through the cover:
§9- §rDisabled: only the cover will be allowed to transfer on this machine side.
§9-§r Allow Filtered (only relevant with a filter!): other transfer will be enabled only if it matches the filter
§9-§r Allow Unfiltered: any other transfer is allowed on this machine side.

Placing a cover of a lower voltage tier on a machine is §asafe§r.

§oYes, you will need more Steam production!§r

The Steam Turbine will help you convert Steam into Electricity. Or so that's the simplest explanation I can think of...

§d2 Steam = 1 EU§r

This one Generator type is the only one you can realistically use in the LV Age. Later you will unlock more power options.


§9Reminder:§r Any machine placed can be rotated with a Wrench. To retrieve a machine (even an electric one), you can simply mine it. Wrenches work, but pickaxes also do.


§oQuest rewards will become less generous from now on.§r

§oTechnically, you could make more or less any LV Machine, but I specifically want you to make the best one of them all first! I know, I know... You're asking where is your freedom of choice.§r

No more painful wires! This machine lets you make §6two Wires from one Ingot§r, that should be three times cheaper than what you were doing up until now!
To the right of this Quest are more important machines which will help you a lot to get cheaper intermediates.


§9Note:§r Recipes inside LV Machines go up to §aUsage: 32 EU/t (LV)§r. Anything higher than that and you will need a MV or even better machine instead. Needless to say that's for later.


§oThis Quest's reward is wonderful. It's called freedom!§r

§oArgueably the second best LV machine to craft, but the choice is yours!§r

This helps converting one §6Ingot into one Plate§r, which is a better ratio than the Forge Hammer.


You will need a Programmed Circuit for recipes. That would be nice if the questbook designer gave one for free, wouldn't it?

You can right click the Programmed Circuit in your hand to change the configuration number.

§oThe Lathe lathes... We should probably rename these machines to avoid these terrible quest introductions!§r

An important machine to help shape metals. Thanks to it, you can turn §6one Ingot into two Rods§r, and §6one Bolt into one screw§r. That's twice the efficiency on those recipes as opposed to crafting.


§bLore:§r The GregTech 5 Lathe produces one Rod and 2 small piles of Dust per Ingot. We also have a setting for this in GTCEu, but it's turned off by default.
The Gregtech 6 Lathe acts like GT5's but bolts lathe into one screw and one 1/72 pile of dust. Cursed!

§oThe Polarizer polarizes... We're doing this again aren't we?§r

One of the cheapest - if not the cheapest - LV machine. Use this to make §6Redstone-free Magnetic Rods§r for your Motors.

§oThis of a chemical reaction, either realistic, theorical or invented by the power of video gaming. The Chemical Reactor will create the conditions for it to happen, and TADAAA. You can also call this a magic box, if you want.§r


The Chemical Reactor will be required for §la lot§r of recipes.
Right now in LV age, you can use it to make... take a look at the quest to the right of this one.

§oAn Iron-Nickel Alloy.§r

It has §6double the durability§r for GregTech tools compared to Iron, making it as sturdy as Steel for that purpose.

§oYou can always come back to this quest later to read what you missed. It will appear in the "Tips and Tricks" tab.§r

Wires and Cables are used to transport EU from Generators to Consumers.

There are four important mechanics to learn about the wires:
§9-§r Insulation
§9- §rVoltage
§9-§r Amperage
§9-§r EU/t loss


§9§lInsulation:§r This is the difference between §dWires§r and §dCables§r. Wires will §celectrocute§r you if they conduct energy, unless they are §6Superconductors§r. So you §oshould§r use Cables or Superconductors. They also have lower loss, more on that below.

§9§lVoltage:§r If your Generator's Voltage Output is higher than what the Cable can support, it will §cburn§r and you will lose them! Voltage is LV, MV, HV... refer to the Chapter names.

§9§lAmperage:§r All Wires and Cables have an §dAmperage limit§r, if they transport above that limit, they will §cburn§r and you will lose them! Generally, it is highly advised to use Cables with an Amperage limit matching your Generators. More details on the Amperage description quest.

§9§lEU/t loss:§r Each time an Energy packet (32EU for LV) passes through a cable, it loses Energy corresponding to the Cable loss. What this means is you should try to build machines pretty close to your Generator! This loss will be less relevant in future voltages. §6Superconductors§r are lossless.


§9Note:§r The Amperage bug, exploit or feature (call it whatever you want!) from GTCE has been §lfixed§r in GTCEu. The Energy network now works as intended.

§oYou can put this quest off and come back to it once you hit MV Age. It will appear in both chapters as well as in the "Tips and Tricks" tab. 


§2§lVoltage:§r LV§r... MV... up to UV or even beyond. Similarly to Cables, all machines accepting EU have a maximum §2Voltage§r Input. Machines will §cexplode§r if you try to overvolt them! On this modpack explosion won't damage anything, but you will still lose your machine. §cDo not connect a LV machine on a MV line!§r

Note that we tend to use the terms "§9Power§r" and "§2Voltage§r" interchangeably while is is technically incorrect. For example 32EU/t is the §9Power§r, for one §bampere§r of §2LV§r.
For simplicity reasons, we will often use the §9Power§r value (EU/t§r) to speak of the §2Voltage§r, with one §bAmp§r being understated.


§b§lAmperage:§r In GregTech, Energy is transferred with the §2Voltage§r and §bAmperage§r parameters.
For any given §2Voltage§r, there may be several §bAmps§r to provide a specific §9Power§r.
(Example: 4 generators, each outputting 32EU/t, for 128EU/t production @4A LV)

Machines consume a fix amount of §bAmps§r, which means you will need to use the appropriate §2Voltage§r to be able to meet the §9Power§r requirement.

To go further into details, regular machines can accept one §bAmp§r by default, and one additional §bAmp§r when the internal Energy buffer is low, for §btwo Amps in§r.
(Example: 4 generators, each outputting 32EU/t, yet a MV machine will only accept 64EU/t @2A LV)


§9§lTL;DR:§r Group up Machines and Generators by §2Voltage§r, and avoid sharing them.


§9Note:§r The Amperage bug, exploit, feature (call it whatever you want!) from GTCE has been §lfixed§r in GTCEu. Now the Energy net works as intended.

§oSo many choices! AAAAAAAhh! Didn't I tell you I would give you freedom!?§r

The LV Age will make you craft a lot of different machines! Are you lost? Here is a tip to set goals: check a lategame item and go from there. So let's say Fusion Controller Mark 3... Nevermind, let's check a closer goal instead. The §dElectric Blast Furnace§r, the main end goal of LV Age.

The EBF is expensive, which is why you should focus first on machines making materials cheaper. Quests will keep helping you for that.

Other important goals are the §dAssembling Machine§r and §aMV Circuits§r.


Talking about goals to note down, take this Clipboard. You will appreciate it.

§oHey you! Yes you! HEY!! Why are you running away!?§r

This quest is a presentation of the §dFull Scale of regular Ore Processing§r. Why "regular" you may ask? Well... some ores are special but that's for much later. Oh no I'm getting carried away!


If you haven't noticed the §aOre Byproduct§r Tab in §aJEI§r, press U on any GT ore, and it should be the second rightmost Tab.
This tab presents all the Ore Processing recipes! As you can see, Ores can give many §6Byproducts§r, some of which do not exist as an Ore.

Whenever you want to obtain a material, refer to that page to see if you can obtain it, and select the process that you will find to be the most suitable.


Each Quest surrounding this one presents a different machine that has some relation to Ore Processing.


§cNote:§r Do not get too carried over with Ore Processing yet! It is slow and somewhat power hungry. Around 90% of ores are not important enough to warrant going out of your way to obtain the Byproducts.
betterquesting:10.name:8: What is this Mess? Part Two

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§oThis machine combines Cauldron washing for simple automation, but also advanced and precise washing for byproducts.§r

Washing a §aCrushed Ore§r will grant a §aPurified Ore§r which can refined further, some useless stone, and more importantly the first §6Byproduct§r.
Any Ore will give at minimum 2/3 dusts of this Byproduct through washing! So prioritize this step the most.

Distilled Water over Water cuts recipe duration in half, but is also less convenient to produce.
A rarely used machine. It uses magnetic fields to separate some Magnetic ores and gain additional §6Byproducts§r you would not obtain otherwise.

§lOutside of Ore Processing:§r
Oh boy this machine does a lot... Decomposition recipes to separate dust types, separating air and many others...
The list is too long, let's just say §cyou need the Centrifuge§r.


§lFor Ore Processing:§r
This takes §aImpure Dust§r or §aPurified Dust§r and turns them into clean Dust plus an added tiny Dust §6Byproduct§r. This is outside of the optimal chain for Byproducts, but this is also the cheapest Ore Processing machine of this set to run and to setup on a small scale.


§bLore:§r In base GTCE, this was the strongest Ore Processing machine as it was fairly easy to use, and gave three tiny dusts, just like the Ore Washer or the Thermal Centrifuge. We tuned it down in favor of diversity.

§lOutside of Ore Processing:§r
This machine, similarly to the Centrifuge, also does a lot of things...
And I cannot list them! But fortunately it's one of the cheapest, so get it whenever you want something from it.


§lFor Ore Processing:§r
So, I lied, it's not §oexactly§r in the Ore Processing, it's actually for §aDecomposition of Dusts§r. However most of this style of Decomposition through Electrolysis is locked at MV.

This Thermal Centrifuge is the most energy hungry out of the Ore Processing machines.
It takes §aCrushed Ore§r or §aPurified Ore§r to give a different §6Byproduct§r from the Ore Washer, but at the same rate.


§bLore:§r The Thermal Centrifuge in GT5 required 48EU/t to run. Yes this is above 32EU/t, but GT5 had special mechanics where certain machines such as this one could accept more than 1 Amp.
In GTCE, the Thermal Centrifuge was made to only work at MV with 60EU/t recipes.
And now to be honest with you... it was awful, never worth it. So we buffed the machine to be much more relevant.

§oThe Fluid Solidifier Solidifies... Or you could say it freezes stuff if you like cursedness.§r

This machine requires molds and fluids to solidify stuff. It won't do anything on its own, but perhaps if you had §amolten Rubber§r...?

While this is an extremely §9important§r machine, this will §9§lnot help you immediately§r as it is expensive. Most of the recipes you want to unlock require §cfluids§r. Get a little bit more infrastructure before rushing this.


The Assembling Machine is core to gameplay. Consider it as important as a Crafting Table, except... well, it's a machine duh.


We as modpack developers also love to use this to include all sorts of custom recipes. And do you know what's the good news? It lets you unlock §dApplied Energistics§r!


Once you have enough Infrastructure, you will be able to make better recipes for:
§9-§r Resistors
§9-§r Circuit Boards
§9-§r Cables


§bLore:§r Back in the days of GregTech 2, the Assembling Machine only had two slots, and was used merely for alternate Circuit and Hull recipes.

§oThis machine does nothing exciting. It puts stuff into stuff.§r

Make this machine only when you feel like it's time you invest into Batteries.

LV Batteries come in three forms, allowing you to pick the one you find the best depending on materials you have.

Be it either §dSodium§r, §dLithium§r or §dCadmium§r, you will need either an Electrolyzer or a Centrifuge to obtain them. They do not exist as ore.

My recommendation is: find a Salt vein, and either §aelectrolyze Salt§r for Sodium, or §aOre wash§r Lepidolite for Lithium.


Get §eany§r of the three batteries to complete this quest.

§oBatteries are great! They let you store energy if you have too little or too much power generation.§r

Make some Battery Alloy, used for Battery Hulls.

Antimony is found in the Nether, do not forget to check that Ore Tab.


§9Note:§r This quest does §lnot§r contain functional Batteries, head to the next one for that!

§oThe mining drill is a nice Mining Tool, it comes in different tiers. The LV Drill may not be too appealing, but later drills can mine 3x3x3, 5x5x5, and up to 9x9x9 to make huge holes!§r

This suggested drill is with a Diamond tip, which might be the best material for it right now.
Also, there's currently a small §mbug§r feature making the Mining Drill mine two blocks in single block mode.


§9Note:§r All Electric Tools have a lot more durability than indicated, as they use Energy to prevent damaged from being applied!

§9Other note:§r Batteries in your inventory can be shift right-clicked to enable charging your EU items. Don't do it §owhile§r mining though, as your item will be constantly updated and it will keep resetting the mining progress. 


You may make hold off and make a MV drill §einstead§r. That one will be completely worth it.


§bLore:§r Up until GTCEu, Electric tools required Stainless Steel, which made them locked until almost HV age.

§oBy itself, the Battery Buffer does nothing. What it does, however, is accept batteries in its inventory, to act as a... buffer... with the... batteries. I hope you got it!§r

The Battery Buffer handles §9two amps in§r, and §9one amp out§r §dper Battery§r. Output side has the dot, all other sides are inputs.

This is a must have if you don't have unlimited power at hand.


§9Note:§r Do not loop your lossy Cables back to your Battery Buffer, you will end up voiding energy!


Get §eeither§r a four slot, or an eight slot Battery Buffer. A sixteen slot variant also exists but that's overkill right now.


§bLore:§r To be frank with you, base GTCE Battery Buffer was mediocre. It has been reworked by yours truly to provide a mix between GT5 and GTCE's functionality. Energy now splits evenly across all batteries!

§oIf you wanted to be picky, it would be Dioxygen, or Oxygen Gas. But gameplay convention makes it simply Oxygen.§r

You could be spending §ominutes§r in JEI looking for Oxygen recipes given the many ways to obtain it. Various minerals will produce it when electrolyzed.

However the best source according to me (!) is §acentrifuging Air§r after making a §dGas Collector§r, which you probably cannot make just yet. This recipe also gives §aNitrogen§r, which can speed up certain §9Electric Blast Furnace§r recipes§r.

The second best source according to me (!) is §aelectrolyzing Silicon Dioxide§r. Silicon Dioxide is obtained from various sources, such as Glass Dust, Granite Dust and Black Granite Dust.

The third best source according to me (!) is §aelectrolyzing Water§r. But that's more for §aHydrogen§r due to the higher energy cost.

The fourth best source according to me (!) is §ato not void§r it, ever. Any Oxygen obtained from any source is worth something and should be stored in Tanks. The §3Steel Multiblock Tank§r is a good candidate for storing Oxygen... Or you can simply make more drums.


§9Note:§r Submit a fluid by having it stored in §lany§r tank in your inventory. A bucket will also work.

§oJust kidding, Tanks for fluids.§r

GregTech contains a lot of crafting with fluid. Drums allow you to store them. Any Drum can be broken and picked up and will §6keep the Fluid§r.

Additionally, internal tanks from machines will accept interacting with an item containing fluid. This is great for manual crafting.

To void Fluid contained in a Drum, place it in your crafting grid.

§9Pssst:§r A Screwdriver right-click allows a Drum to drain its content into another container placed under. This is great to keep Lava Boilers fueled for longer.


§oDo not attempt to buffer Steam using Drums, §ma massive Creeper will be dropped in your base§r§o. Buffering Steam is bad, it's unethical, I beg you. *sobbing face*§r


Get §eeither§r of the proposed Drums to complete this quest.


§bLore:§r The drums are actually ported from GregTech 6!

The Sifter takes §dGem type§r §aPurified Ores§r to turn them into high grade gems with §6higher yield§r than other means.


§9Note:§r If you crushed Gem Ores (such as Diamond), it is primordial you use this machine to recover the actual gems in non dust form. However this is a rather slow process so you may sometimes want to smelt this type of ore directly into the Gem.

The Autoclave typically is the last step of Ore Processing, to turn a few select §aGem Dusts§r back regular Gems.

It is very slow so in general it is not advised to crush gem ores at all, as the recovery process is too expensive.


§9Note:§r In this modpack, the Autoclave is required to make Fluix Crystals to progress in Applied Energistics.

Prepare §a128 Cupronickel§r, §a32 Bronze§r and §a16 Tin Alloy§r to craft the Heating Coils for your Electric Blast Furnace.

This is still less than half of the cost of the entire EBF in raw materials. You will also need a couple stacks of Invar and Steel.


The Cupronickel Coils will allow the EBF to perform recipes up to 1,800K (ignoring Voltage bonuses). That's pretty hot if you ask me.

§oThis Quest explains the core mechanic of the Electric Blast Furnace, while other Quests will explain the mechanics of the Parts, so be sure to refer to them!§r

The EBF is a beefy boy. The minimum power cost to run a recipe is §9120EU/t§r! This is why it was locked behind the Battery Quests.

You will use the EBF to make §aAluminium§r and progress to §dMV Age§r.

§oThe description of the machine refers to metallurgy where Blast Furnace and Arc Furnace serve a similar purpose, not exactly here though!§r

The Arc Furnace uses a little bit of Oxygen to smelt items in a different fashion than Furnaces.

You can use it to make easier §aWrought Iron§r, §aGlass§r, and gain access to §aAnnealed Copper§r.
It can also recycle various components and machines back to their original material.


§bLore:§r Previous versions had both the Arc Furnace and the Plasma Arc Furnace. But why not use one machine for both? Recipes using Plasma are available only after Fusion is unlocked.

§oThe Steam Extractor extracts... Wait no this was in the line one chapter ago!§r

The reason I did not present LV versions of Steam machines is because they are not required! You may not want to invest into an upgrade that virtually does nothing. Except for §othis one§r specifically because it does more.


The Basic Extractor gains Fluid capabilities, which enables §aFluid Extraction§r. Use it to melt Rubber that you previously solidified, to melt Soldering Alloy for your circuits, to melt Redstone Alloy for the §6best Vacuum Tube recipe§r in the Assembler!


§bLore:§r Did you notice this machine is both an Extractor and a Fluid Extractor? The two of them were separated in previous versions of GregTech.

§oTime to end the misery of hand crafting rotors!§r

Use both your machines to turn a material into a Fluid, and solidify it back to a Rotor! This combination makes up for §6four Ingots per Rotor§r.
You can also do the same for §6Gears§r and §6Small Gears§r, which will then be superseded by the §3MV Extruder§r.


§9Note:§r Some metals require higher voltage than LV for Fluid Extraction, so keep that in mind.

§oI know what you're thinking! Don't think! I mean... Maintenance in GregTech is not as bad as you think, and looking at multiblocks with this hatch makes me feel happy.§r

Most Multiblocks require a Maintenance Hatch. You will need to do Maintenance for the Multiblock to begin operating.
This is done by having a §9Wrench§r, a §9Screwdriver§r, a §9Soft Mallet§r, a §9Hammer§r, a §9Wire Cutter§r, and a §9Crowbar§r in your inventory, opening the Maintenance Hatch and §3clicking the center spot once§r. §cNo need to move tools individually§r.
Alternatively you can fix problems by placing a §9Tape§r in the Maintenance Hatch, but I would love to tell you that's unethical.

Maintenance problems may occur §dafter 48 real hours of activity§r. Needless to say they are very rare. Each problem increases the recipe durations by 10%. Fixing the problems is done the same way as above.


At HV age, you will unlock other Maintenance Hatches that do not enforce fixing the problems manually.


§bLore:§r Maintenance dates back to GregTech 3 for Minecraft 1.5.2. That's a long time ago!
Maintenance problems increased power usage instead of duration. And that caused all sorts of "happy" issues. Ah, fun times!
betterquesting:10.name:8: This is not as Scary as it looks #1.

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§oIt is time to stop processing Resin through the Extractor.§r

You can now centrifuge Resin, which will still give the Raw Rubber, alongside with §aGlue§r (and the less useful Plantball).

Make a lot of Glue. You can use for §6cheaper Resistors§r, §6cheaper Circuit Boards§r, an exclusive Name Tag §din the Assembling Machine§r and more... §oin the next quest§r.


§9Note:§r Submit a fluid by having it stored in §lany§r tank in your inventory. A bucket will also work.

§oI'm not sure why it's called "Good" Circuit Board, as I consider it rather evil to craft.§r

This Circuit Board is used to create §dMV Circuits§r!


§9Note:§r You have §ltwo§r options to make the Phenolic Circuit Board. Using §aSodium Persulfate§r, making boards takes §6only a quarter of the Silver§r as opposed to the crafting recipe.
§lHowever§r given how painful it may be for you to obtain these chemicals §oright now§r, you may want to simply use more Silver by mining most of a Galena Vein...


The Quest for Sodium Persulfate is in the MV chapter, if you are interested in that.

§oDon't let JEI fool you, there's only one available recipe right now for this Primitive Diode.§r

Diode has a inconvenient recipe, but it will get cheaper and more convenient once you can obtain Polyethylene.
This is required for §dMV Circuits§r.

§oThe Chemical Bath bathes... You thought this was over didn't you?§r


§lOutside of Ore Processing:§r
You can make §6Paper out of Wood§r, to throw away your sugar canes. I know you hate them.
There are some other less important recipes.


§lFor Ore Processing:§r
Some §aCrushed Ores§r have an alternate recipe on the way to §aPurified Ore§r, involving bathing in either §aMercury§r or §aSodium Persulfate§r. This step is not really important, unless you really want that special §6Byproduct§r. This can be a nice alternate source of Gold.

Gallium and Arsenic do not exist as Ore!


For §dGallium§r, you may:
§9- §aElectrolyze Sphalerite§r for a low chance of small dust (worst solution).
§9-§r Put §aCrushed Bauxite in the Chemical Bath§r, but that requires Sodium Persulfate.
§9-§r Obtain it as a Byproduct of §aSphalerite§r Ore Processing, in the §aThermal Centrifuge§r or Centrifuge (best solution).


For §dArsenic§r, you will have to mine and §acentrifuge Realgar§r.

§oThis Mixer mixes... What did you expect at this point?§r

Put this machine off until you actually require it for recipes in progression.


Some hand alloys can also be made in the mixer, except at higher yield.

§oMV Circuits! Does this mean MV Age...? Well, do you have Aluminium?§r

Each Electric Age has Circuits corresponding to its tier. The Good Electronic Circuit is the §dfirst MV Circuit§r you can make, out of three.

The next thing you should probably do is craft a Circuit Assembling Machine to make more circuits! For cheaper!


§6Having this and Aluminium will grant access to MV Machines.§r

§oHopefully your first MV Circuit expense.§r

From now on, all Circuits will be made in a Circuit Assembler. Use it now to §amake cheaper LV and MV circuits§r.


§bLore:§r The Circuit Assembler appears in and out of GregTech versions. GT5 did not have it, and it was added in GT5 Unofficial. GTCE did not port it, and it was added back in GTCEu.

§bAluminium§r is the main ingredient for §bMV§r machine hulls. You will need a lot of it, so be sure to set up a good system for processing §bAluminium Dust§r.

With LV power, the only way of getting Aluminium Dust is by electrolyzing §9Sapphire§r or §2Green Sapphire§r. Once you setup an §bMV Electrolyzer§r, you can get Aluminium through many other ores. All of this quest's rewards bear Aluminium.

The process of smelting Aluminium can be accelerated with §9Nitrogen§r, which is obtained by centrifuging §bAir§r from a Gas Collector.


§6You will still need MV Circuits in order to make MV machines.§r

§oSteel can form a lot of Alloys... such as Blue Steel, Red Steel, Black Steel... Fun names?§r


Vanadiumsteel is required in small quantities in progression. It is §6nearly four time as durable§r as Steel for GregTech tools. The Vanadium comes from §aVanadium Magnetite§r, which you have probably encountered in Magnetite veins.


Take some Blue Steel free of charge, that one is twice as durable as Steel.

The Gas Collector collects Air, to centrifuge into §aOxygen§r and §aNitrogen§r.


§bLore:§r GregTech 5 players remember when they had to use a Compressor with IC2 cells to get Compressed Air... In here, cell chemistry is no more.

§oTo power Multiblocks with energy, you need Energy Hatches.§r

Multiblocks do not look at Voltage of recipes, instead they simply check if they have the Power requirement.
The EBF needs at least 120EU/t power input to run its recipes. It is achieved with two LV Energy Hatches. Each one takes 2 Amps of LV, so that's 4 Amps of LV for 128EU/t maximum power.


§9Note:§r Be wary of Cable losses bringing the actual power input below the recipe requirement! I §lhighly§r recommend placing your Battery Buffer next to the Energy Hatches for the minimum cable length.

§oThis is a Guide to help you form Multiblocks and troubleshoot issues.§r

There are two really important factors to know when building Multiblocks.

§lCheck the JEI preview:§r This one was probably obvious, but there's more than just a picture of how the Multiblock looks like! Use your mouse to §drotate§r the preview, §9hover over the parts§r to gain additional informations. The JEI page also contains the amount of blocks to build it. You can also §dright-click§r a block in the preview to get a display of all available blocks in that placement.


§lThe JEI preview is a suggestion:§r There is no unique way to form the Multiblock. Most of the time, you have complete freedom for the §9tier of Buses/Hatches§r. And you also have the §dfreedom of placement§r.

Taking the EBF as example, any tier of Energy/Bus/Hatch can be used, and they can be placed anywhere replacing a casing. Fluid Hatches are also optional, though you probably want them to handle recipes with fluid.



If a multiblock is formed, but you are having troubles figuring out why it does not run:
§9-§r Check if the Multiblock is properly plugged in (we all make these mistakes!).
§9-§r Do the initial Maintenance fix.
§9-§r Verify the recipe usage, the max EU/t has to be greater than that of the recipe.
§9- §rCheck the special requirements the recipe may have (JEI always has some kind of indication for it)
§9-§r Make sure the recipe is properly input, this is less obvious than in a regular machine because you have to juggle between Input Bus and Input Hatch
§9-§r Make sure there is space for output. The biggest offender is the Output Hatches being too low tier and having too little capacity!

Similarly to the Steam Multiblocks (I hope you made them!), you will need Buses to move items in and out.
For fluids, you will need Hatches.

That is it, folks!

§oCheck the recipe from the wire, and then in the Material JEI page, check the recipe for the dust. Handy isn't it?§r

Now is probably time to put some lossless wires everywhere! Don't get too addicted, they do not come cheap.


§bNote:§r No version of GregTech had actual Superconductors for LV up until Gregicality and GTCEu. Though some modpacks had lossless cables.

§oThis Quest in an overview for the Large Bronze Boiler.§r

§9I do §lNOT§r§9 recommend§r getting this until you are done with most - if not all - of the LV Age. It is also §6optional§r, depending on which power options you chose.


The Large Bronze Boiler ultimately is §othe§r option for large scale Steam production. It will run off solid and liquid fuels.
§cImportant:§r This Boiler can also §cexplode§r similarly to the regular Boilers! I would like to say the explosion is not kind... but it's configured to not damage blocks or entities.
§cWater supply is crucial§r. But simply upgrading the Output Hatch on your §3Primitive Pump§r should be enough.


Once fully heated up, the LBB produces 800 Steam per tick, which is §d400EU/t§r after conversion, or 12.5 Basic Steam Turbines! This immense (relative!) power comes at the cost of §la lot§r of burnable fuel.
§5§lBut§r the GUI can let you §9throttle§r the Boiler, down to 25% power for 200 Steam per tick. That is §d100EU/t§r, or slightly above 3 Basic Steam Turbines.


§9Note:§r More information about Multiblocks are given after you get the Electric Blast Furnace at the end of the LV Age. That's one way to prevent you from getting this too early!

Use your freshly made Chemical Reactor to unlock a new, §6better recipe for Rubber§r. It is in the form of fluid though.

Make an §dSolidifier§r (Quest just above!) to solidify directly into §aRubber Sheets§r.

Make an §dAssembling Machine§r (Quest just below!) to use the molten Rubber for §aCables§r.


If I were you, I would make this machine adjacent to the Fluid Solidifier to automatically make Sheets. Sheets can be melted back (more on that on a later Quest...).


§9Note:§r Submit a fluid by having it stored in §lany§r tank in your inventory. A bucket will also work.

§oJust kidding, Silicon Wafers in this mod are perfectly fungible.§r

§9Silicon Boules§r are made in the EBF with lots of §9Silicon Dust§r and a small amount of §9Gallium Arsenide§r. After making the Boule, cut it in the §9Cutting Machine§r to get 16 Silicon Wafers ready for engraving.

§cWarning:§r Each Silicon Boule takes §c7.5 minutes§r to make at 120 EU/t, or §c1,080,000 EU§r! If the EBF loses power midway, the recipe will start to §close progress§r. Be sure you have enough power before starting.

Getting into Applied Energistics at this point is a little bit involved...
You will need quite a few LV machines, and the LV-tier recipes for some AE2 are more expensive without more advanced technology.

In LV age you have access to:
§6-§r Energy Acceptor
§6-§r Charger (to charge FE related items!)
§6-§r ME Terminal
§6-§r 1k ME Storage component
§6-§r ME Chest
§6-§r Portable Cell

Multiblock Tanks can store a larger amount of fluid, but aren't portable like Drums are. The §6Steel Multiblock Tank§r holds §a1,000,000 mB§r of fluid.

A §6Wooden§r§r version exists which holds §a250,000 mB§r, but it cannot store §chot fluids§r such as Lava, or §cgases§r such as Oxygen.


Fluid transfer is done through the Controller block, or up to two additional Valve blocks.
Valves can §dauto-output§r by making them §dface down§r. Using Pumps Covers is also an option.


These optional yet fancy Tanks are alternatives to fluid storage until you unlock the greater §9Super Tanks§r.

Item Pipes are a simple yet very effective way to move items around §dinstantly§r, but with throughput limitations.
Higher tier pipes provide ridiculously large throughput, a rare sight in modded Minecraft!

Item Pipes §9do not pull§r, but they will push any item inserted into them to other connected inventories, prioritizing §9the closest§r first.
The priority stat is less important, but it may come handy for medium size pipe networks.


Right now, you can use them in combination with §6Hoppers§r, but you will also be able to use them with Conveyor Modules, Output Buses, and machine Auto-Outputs all in the LV age.

You can use your Wrench to disconnect a side of a pipe.


§bLore:§r Oooooh YEAH! Item Pipes were in GregTech 5, and for whatever reason they were not kept for GTCE, so you had to use other mods to transport items. Who does that!? Jokes aside, I hope you love Item Pipes being back in GregTech!

§5Player:§r §oThat's it, I give up, you are going insane! We are in LV Age but you present me a HV machine!?§r

§5Writer:§r §oHold on... There must have been a reason. Ah! Let me grab my script.§r


Yes! This is indeed not completable yet, which is also why this quest appears in the HV Chapter.

Remember the thing about Macerator I told you that made you feel unxtremely sad and disappointed? Well... that disappointment is gonna keep going until then.

§6The Macerator will unlock its second and third slot at HV§r. And this will be great for Ore Processing. In fact if you check the Ore Processing JEI page, you will see that one byproduct is absolutely locked by this, after the Thermal Centrifuge step.


§5Writer:§r §oCome back at me when you are stronger, young Padawan.§r

§oSoldering Alloy is used to... solder... things in the Assembler of Circuit Assembler.§r

Soldering Alloy is used solely as a fluid, and in most cases is replaceable with Tin.
The choice will be yours, spend more materials? Or spend less time crafting materials?

Now that you have Steel, you can make a Hang Glider! This may help tremendously for Nether exploration.

If you do not have enough Leather yet, make a §9Butchering Knife§r and hunt some cows.


§bLore:§r Hang Glider comes from OpenBlocks. Due to great utility of the Hang Glider, it was ported to a separated mod for people who do not want OpenBlocks in their modpack (like us!).

§oAlright, making this is quite involved, this has to be good right?
Also, this is not the final item, this is only an Empty Spray Can, filling it with Chemical Dye is even more involved!§r


So, the Spray Cans are functionally useless, but §3visually appealing and useful§r!

Any (or almost) GregTech TileEntity can be painted to one of the 16 colors of your chosing. This is great for screenshots, or to separate different setups for visualization in a Multiplayer base. They also help with distinguishing between pipelines and cables.


§oBut oh boy these are not too fun to make, let us know what you think about it.§r

The Prospector is an amazing tool to find veins.

Its GUI is interactive, and... I do not have much more to say.
§6It is great§r.


§bLore:§r §oBack in MY days, the portable Prospector was locked to LuV.§r

The Electric Blast Furnace requires a Muffler Hatch to run. This hatch must be §cunobstructed§r so it can output its beautiful smoke particles.

When a recipe is performed, there is a small chance for the Muffler Hatch to give bonus items, typically tiny Dusts of Ash.

§9Note:§r Do not try to automate the extraction of items from the Muffler Hatch, it is not intended. It voids excess when full, so do not worry about it stopping machines from running.


§bLore:§r In GregTech 5, polluting multiblocks had Muffler Hatches. The higher tier the hatch, the lower the Pollution.
Pollution had interesting effects such as turning grass and dirt into sand.
Muffler Hatches in GTCEu are more about the look (can you deny that the particles look good!?) and small rewards, rather than punishing game mechanics.
betterquesting:10.name:8: This is not as Scary as it looks #2.

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§oDid you hate crafting the components in the previous tier? They're back, and stronger!§r

Here is a list of the components you will need in the MV Age.

Conveyors, Pumps and Robot Arms are upgrades to LV versions if you use them as covers.

Before we start, here's something to consider:
With the §aOil§r route, you will need a §3LV Distillery§r.
With the §aBiomass§r route, you will need a §3MV Distillery§r.
Get §eeither§r to complete this quest.



Now, let's discuss a complex topic: §9Distillation§r. This guide will help you understand how and why the §aJEI§r recipes are the way they are, so stick with me!

Nearly all the §3Distillery§r recipes are duplicates from the §3Distillation Tower§r, except that they only have one Fluid output, and void everything else.
In other words, you could argue the §3Distillery§r is an §dinferior§r §3Distillation Tower§r.

This doesn't mean that the §3Distillery§r is always inferior though. It is unlocked earlier. It is §dsmaller§r, §dcheaper§r, and §dmore energy efficient§r per recipe.
In many cases, you won't even mind losing the other Fluids.


§3Distilleries§r are an essential component for power generation, whether you pick §aDiesel§r or §aBenzene§r.
You will want many of them, and as low tier as possible to avoid the energy losses from Overclocking.

The §aPyrolyse Oven§r processes §aorganic§r products by thermal decomposition in an inert environment. Depending on how the Oven is configured, §7Charcoal§r, §7Coke§r, or §7Ashes§r will be produced, as well as one of a multitude of §6organic byproducts§r.§r Those byproducts can be Distilled for an array of organic resources, with different byproducts giving different ratios of different chemicals.

Presently it is used for turning §2Bio Chaff§r into §aBiomass§r, or §6Wood§r into §7Wood Tar§r, which can be processed into §7Benzene§r for power.

You can §adouble the speed§r of §6Wood§r processes with §bNitrogen§r gas.

§oHave you seen the Oil spouts when wandering around, or mined into a deposit of Oil?§, 

Get a Pump, place it above an Oil spout and Power it!§r Do §cnot§r pump above an Ocean, as currently there is a flaw in the pump logic, and it will attempt to pull water, resulting in getting the Pump stuck.
I recommend you bring up a §3Battery Buffer§r, and a lot of §3Drums§r. A Super Tank would be better, but that's not quite available yet!

Do not forget to §dchunkload§r with FTB:Utilities (claim the chunk with left-click, and enable force loading with shift-left-click).


§9Note:§r This Quest is an entry point towards §9Polyethylene§r, an important goal for the MV Age.
This path is §doptional§r. Basically, you have two choices to get to §9Polyethylene§r, either §aBiomass§r or §aOil§r.


§bLore:§r Oil geysers were originally from Buildcraft. If you played a GregTech 5 modpack without Buildcraft, you needed to use the Fluid Rig and tap randomly to try and get lucky... or wait until HV age to do a rudimentary prospection.

§oHey! That's Alcohol!§r

Put your previously made §aBiomass§r into a §3MV Distillery§r, to make §aEthanol§r.
You will need this for §dEthylene§r by reacting it with §aSulfuric Acid§r in a §3Chemical Reactor§r... unless you chose the Oil path.


Do not try to use Ethanol as a Power source... You may regret it.
If you want plant based §9Power§r, I suggest §dBenzene§r instead!

§oTurning plant matter into fuel? That doesn't sound industrial enough!§r

For this route, you will need plant matter. §aSaplings§r work and will give you Biomass in the §3Brewery§r at decent rates.
Othe§rrwise, you may go the §aPlantball§r into §aBio Chaff§r route, and then turn it into Biomass either in the §3Brewery§r or the §3Pyrolyse Oven§r, the latter being more efficient but obvisouly requires a whole Multiblock.


§bLore:§r Plantball and Bio Chaff orignate from IndustrialCraft2. In IC2 Experimental, there was this rather obscure way to turn Biomass into Biogas for power, which usually required too much investment to be really worth it.

§oIf you read the previous Quest, this shouldn't be too bad. If you didn't... What are you waiting for!?§r

Distillating §aOil§r will give you Fuel that you will need to desulfurize.

§aHydrogen Sulfide§r is perfectly §drecycled§r in an §3Electrolyzer§r.
If you automate this process, simply place your Chemical Reactor and your Electrolyzer next to each other.


§aLight Fuel§r is a good §9Power§r option. But there is something even greater in a nearby Quest.

§oJEI will probably overwhelm you for this, so I'm presenting you the best path for Sulfuric Acid here.§r


Making Sulfuric Acid is a three step process. It is used in many important reactions, so you should automate its production soon.

To do so, you will need §3three LV Chemical Reactors§r. I would recommend building an isolated node somewhere with one §3LV Generator§r to power all three machines. And then spaghetti the pipes for input and output (...or simply use AE2).

§9-§r Step 1: React §aSulfur§r with §aOxygen§r, to form §aSulfur Dioxide§r.
§9-§r Step 2: React §aSulfur Dioxide§r with more §aOxygen§r, to form §aSulfur Trioxide§r.
§9-§r Step 3: React §aSulfur Trioxide§r with §aWater§r, to form §aSulfuric Acid§r.

Why am I not presenting these steps in the retrieval tasks...? So you don't have to make sure to submit every single one of them, that would be way too tedious if every quest were like that!


§cNote:§r We have a bot command on our Discord, called $medicine: "Do not attempt this in real life, it is not only illegal but also stupidly dangerous".
This applies to toying with chemicals. Please don't do it.


§bLore:§r GregTech 5's Chemical Reactor only had one Fluid slot. To circumvent that, they would do cell chemistry. Now the way you would automate Sulfuric Acid was by having one cell travel from machine to machine and then looping back. A somewhat fun and interesting challenge, but also a chore!

§oFuel and Oil cracking can get complicated. But let's not get too bothered about it. It's mostly done to get hydrocarbons.§r

There are many ways to acquire §dEthylene§r from Oil processing.
The best way is to steam-crack §aLight Fuel§r in a §3Chemical Reactor§r. Be sure to make the §aSeverely Steam-Cracked§r version for a higher yield of Ethylene. Once in HV Age, you will have the option to do this recipe in the §3Cracking Unit§r.

The tantalizing §9Distillation Tower§r process for Oil products is sadly not available - yet! You will have to use a §3Distillery§r to get §dEthylene§r.

§oOne of many hydrocarbons, congratulations on making it here!§r

The way to obtain this is described in the previous Quest, whichever you did.

§oYour first polymer! Or if you want to be less fancy, just call it plastic, but hide in a corner first.§r

For the polymerization process, add §aOxygen§r. That's better than Air.
Then solidify like you would with Rubber.


§aPolyethylene (PE)§r is the key to unlock §6many new things§r. It's used mostly as §dSheets§r or §dFluid§r form.
No spoilers here! Let's have you figure out what it does with all the next Quests, one by one.


§bLore:§r The OreDict and fluid name for Polyethylene is §oplastic§r, for cross-mod compatibility.

§oSodium Persulfate is used to etch Copper on Circuit Boards... Something like that, among other things.§r

Sodium Persulfate can be used to make cheaper §aGood Circuit Boards§r, as it cuts the Silver amount by a factor of four.
It is also required to make §aPlastic Circuit Boards§r, as the Iron III Chloride recipe is locked behind HV.

Sodium Persulfate can also be used in §9Ore Processing§r in the §3Chemical Bath§r, to get various bonus outputs you would not normally obtained. It is completely optional, but pretty rewarding.

Making Sodium Persulfate will yield §aHydrochloric Acid§r as a coproduct. You can store it for future uses or electrolyze it to recover Chlorine and Hydrogen.

§oAlright, you have made a Polymer already, how about you make another one?§r

§aPolyvinyl Chloride (PVC)§r is the 3rd-most produced plastic in real life. Here, it can be used in place of Polyethylene in production of §aPlastic Circuit Boards§r and other items to increase the yield.

PVC item pipes also have the §6highest throughput§r available for a while, if your setups need it.

§9Pro tip:§r the fluid form of PVC is never used in base GTCEu, so feel free to solidify all of it into sheets.

§oRemember the Ore Processing Quest referencing the Electrolyzer? It told you that you had to wait until MV, so here we are.§r

The Advanced Electrolyzer allows you to decompose §6all§r Dusts. This will make getting materials such as §aAluminium§o§§ a lot easier!

Clay is an extremely §mbalanced§r useful material for electrolysis.
All four output Dusts are great.

You will need §a§ra total of §a416 Clay Dust§r for this quest. You may also want to look into other sources of similar materials, such as §aSodalite§r. Check JEI for some ideas.

You should use Sodium and/or Lithium to make some §6MV Batteries§r.
The Assembling Machine is a staple for every Tier, an important goal to unlock more recipes and progress further into the Age.

§oMore upgrades...! you will need the MV Cutting Machine, for... MV recipes, duh!§r


I recommend you run this machine with §dLubricant§r.

The §aLaser Engraver§r engraves patterns into §9Silicon Wafers§r based on the type of §9Lens§r it is given. After the wafers are engraved, they must be passed through a §9Cutting Machine§r to turn them into components ready to be put into Circuits. Higher tier Engravers can etch more complex wafers for more efficient Circuits.

For now, the §aIntegrated Logic Circuit§r will be the one of interest, but the others will become important for higher tier Circuits.

You have unlocked a new Tier of Circuits!
The Integrated Logic Circuit is an alternate §aLV Circuit§r, which can be upgraded to §aMV§r, and then §aHV§r.


§9Note:§r This is not a strict upgrade to the cost of Circuits, you would need to get to the next Tier for that, just slightly further down in the MV Age. Why would you need this Circuit type then? You need it to get to §6HV circuits§r.


§bLore:§r The circuit progression in GTCEu is mostly based on GT5u's progression. However it has been rebalanced to not be as painful, specifically this circuit tier which was a complete bait!
The MV Circuit for the Integrated Tier.

§oAlright, technically HV Circuit and Stainless Steel means you can move to HV... but let's not rush things.§r

The first thing you should probably do is a §3MV Circuit Assembler§r, to unlock the new tier of Circuits right away, as they are the §dreal payoff§r.

At this point, you have all the tools available to you to make Plastic Boards.

The recipes are pretty long, so I recommend processing large batches in two dedicated §3Chemical Reactors§r.

§oI'm running out of things to say for these quests... I hope you get the gist of it, and don't need too many explanations.§r

As for every Tier goes, the §3Circuit Assembler§r is an essential part of the Progression, to enable a new Tier of circuits.


At this point you should use an §3Extractor§r next to your Circuit Assembler and send off dozens of stacks of §aSoldering Alloy§r Ingots.

§6The best LV Circuits§r! You will be making these for the remainder of the game.

Eventually (in EV Age), they will become even cheaper.

§6The best MV Circuits§r! You will be making these for the remainder of the game.

Eventually (in IV Age), they will become even cheaper.
A Circuit Component, that you can now make thanks the §3MV Assembler§r.
A Circuit Component, that you can now make thanks the §3MV Assembler§r.

A Circuit Component, that you can now make thanks the §3MV Assembler§r.

If you want to make them cheaper, you may smelt §aNickel-Zinc Ferrite§r.

Better HV Circuits, much §6cheaper§r and easier to make than from the previous Tier.


§6You should now be ready to move on the HV Chapter§r, unless you still need to scale up Power Production.
This one will be needed during the HV Age.

§oMore complex Alloys require higher Tier machines to mix the Dusts together.§r

This is the first step to dive deeper in the MV Age.

§oThis quest acts as a small tutorial to automate the Electrolyzer easily!§r

The §9Smart Item Filter§r is a filter based on Recipe Maps. Placed on the side of a machine, this Filter can be selected to Electrolyzer to allow insertion of only Items that can be electrolyzed.

To circumvent the Electrolyzer getting stuck with not enough inputs, place a §cRobot Arm with a Smart Item Filter§r on your Electrolyzer. Configure it to §dImport§r, §dSupply Exact§r. Now, attach any inventory (a chest will do) on the side where you placed the Robot Arm, and TADAA! You have made automatic smart insertion to handle all Electrolyzer recipes!

§9Note:§r The Robot Arm has to do Item transfer itself for its functionality to work! Inserting directly into the machine will ignore the Robot Arm's §dSupply Exact§r.


Now, as for the output of the Electrolyzer, you may want to route the Fluids to several Tanks, or even §3Super Tanks§r. I highly recommend §cto not void§r the Fluids, except for Water for obvious reasons.

Stainless Steel is pretty much any Steel you may encounter in everyday's life. It is extremely resilient against corrosion.§r§r
