Stainless Steel is the material for §6HV§r components, like Aluminium for §bMV§r and Steel for §7LV§r. It is also used in the §6Distillation Tower§r.
It requires §cChrome§r, obtained mainly from §cRuby§r, and §2Manganese§r, obtained from §2Pyrolusite§r and others in its vein.

Smelting Stainless Steel requires §dHV Power§r, which I highly doubt you have at this point. Scaling Power Production is crucial!

What I would §9recommend§r would be to get a second EBF going. They can share blocks, so that is only §a10 Cupronickel Coils§r instead of 16.
Have one EBF run off MV, for Aluminium and any other recipes requiring MV Power, and one running off HV with §32 MV Energy Hatches§r.

The Brewery can be used to make §aLubricant§r from §aRedstone§r and §aCreosote§r/§aOil§r.

Lubricant has its uses here and there, but is mostly for the §3Cutting Machine§r. That significantly reduces duration of recipes.



§9Note:§r This Quest is an entry point towards §9Polyethylene§r, an important goal for the MV Age.
The Brewery is used for §9Biomass§r, a path that is §doptional§r. Basically, you have two choices to get to §9Polyethylene§r, either §aBiomass§r or §aOil§r.


§bLore:§r §oYou can make a Brewery if you want to build up a company and start selling Booze... Oh wait nevermind, wrong GregTech version.§r

§oSuper Tanks are OP!! No but seriously.§r

This is the ultimate portable Fluid storage solution. §64,000 buckets storage§r in one single block! Like Drums, Super Tanks keep their fluids when broken, and can be cleared in the crafting grid.

For §9even more§r storage, use higher tier Super Tanks or AE2 Fluid Storage Cells.
No Description
No Description
No Description

§oFluid Rigs are coming up soon in GTCEu, they will pump "under bedrock" virtual fluid veins, typically Oil.§r


There are four types of Oil.

§9§lOil:§r your standard Oil, richer in §aLight Fuel§r.

§9§lLight Oil:§r richer in §aRefinery Gas§r, generally considered as the worst.

§9§lHeavy Oil:§r richer in §aHeavy Fuel§r, and requires MV to process.

§9§lRaw Oil:§r essentially a less dense version of §aOil§r.

§oI hope at no point you made the LV Extruder, because only the MV Extruder is actually useful. If you did, I suggest you recycle it through the Arc Furnace.§r

The Extruder shapes solid materials into (almost!) any form using §aIngots§r. This is a great way to reduce the amount of microcrafting, as well as keeping a high conversion ratio.

The Extruder can make §6Bolts§r, §6§6Small Gears§r, §6Gears§r, and §6§6Rings§r at the highest efficiency in a single step!
You may also like to use it for §dPipes§r, §dLong Rods§r, and §dRotors§r (though less efficiently for Rotors).

§oA LV Battery Buffer and two LV Energy Hatches are not so convenient, let's remedy that!§r

Upgrade your Electric Blast Furnace with a §3MV Energy Hatch§r, so you can run it off MV Generators.

§oThe Cutting Machine... cuts... thanks to lubrification.§r

For now, you may use §9Water§r over trying to acquire Lubricant.


This is the only way to obtain §aGem Plates§r, which are needed to craft Filters.

You can also cut §aRods into four Bolts§r.

§oNow you might wonder, why is every machine duplicated across all tiers? Because you might want them for overclocking.§r

Overclocking is a mechanic that happens when you try to run a recipe in a machine §dthat is higher tier than the recipe itself§r.
Overclocking implies:
§9-§r 2x recipe speed
§9-§r 4x power consumption
§9-§r 2x total energy cost

As you can see there are upsides and downsides. It is a game of balancing decisions: if you want to cut time duration at the cost of greater consumption.
You and only you can answer this question.
§9However I will tell you this:§r for automated setups, overclock as little as possible!


Machines have a button to set the Overclocking tier. Click on it to cycle through all the available Voltages, and set it on §dX§r to disable Overclocking.


§bLore:§r GTCE overclocking was extremely awkward... If the recipe consumed 8EU/t or below, it would do a classic overclock. However if the recipe consumed more than 8EU/t, every Overclock would be 2.8x faster!
GTCEu has a config to select the Overclock speed bonus, it is a very sensible value.

§oAutocrafting at last!§r

§aPatterns§r are used for AE2 autocrafting. Using §aPolyvinyl Chloride§r increases the yield by §64 times§r.

§9§aTransformers§r allow you to step up and down Voltage tiers safely. Transformers change the power they receive into an equivalent amount of power 1 voltage tier above or below the input voltage.

Apart from running machines on different voltage tiers, Transformers are useful for transporting power across longer distances. Cable loss has less of an effect at higher voltages.

Transformers have 5 low voltage sides, and 1 high voltage side.

This quest calls for two different types of Transformers; get §eeither§o§r to complete the quest. The §9normal§r Transformer can only do 1A <-> 4A conversion, but §9Adjustable§r Transformers can be changed between 1A <-> 4A, 2A <-> 8A, 4A <-> 16A, and 16A <-> 64A conversions. 

Use a §aSoft Hammer§r to change between transform up and down, and a §aScrewdriver§r on Adjustable Transformers to change the amperage.

(not final)
Crates can store more items.
Crates can take Covers.
Crates kinda suck because <reason>
